    • post /auth/user/signout

Greep (1.0.0) swagger 2 source

The Greep API

Auth/Emails

Signup with email to the application


post ... /auth/emails/signup Try Out

  • Request
  • Response
  • Coding

formData

firstName REQUIRED

string

User's first name.

middleName REQUIRED

string

User's middle name.

lastName REQUIRED

string

User's last name.

description REQUIRED

string

User's profile description.

email REQUIRED

string

User's email address.

photo OPTIONAL

User profile picture.

Example Value | Model

{
    "name": "",
    "type": "",
    "size": "",
    "path": "",
    "timestamp": "",
    "link": ""
}
  • name * string
  • type * string
  • size * number
  • path * string
  • timestamp * number
  • link * string,null
password REQUIRED

string

User password.

200

Example Value | Model

{
    "accessToken": "",
    "requestToken": "",
    "user": {
        "hash": "",
        "id": "",
        "email": "",
        "password": "",
        "description": "",
        "name": {
            "first": "",
            "middle": "",
            "last": ""
        },
        "photo": "",
        "isVerified": "",
        "authTypes": [
            {}
        ],
        "roles": {
            "isAdmin": "",
            "isSuperAdmin": ""
        },
        "lastSignedInAt": "",
        "signedUpAt": ""
    }
}
  • accessToken * string
  • requestToken * string
  • user * object Additional Properties: false
    • hash * string
    • id * string
    • email * string
    • password * string
    • description * string
    • name * object Additional Properties: false
      • first * string
      • middle * string
      • last * string
    • photo * undefined
    • isVerified * boolean
    • roles * object Additional Properties: false
      • isAdmin boolean
      • isSuperAdmin boolean
    • lastSignedInAt * number
    • signedUpAt * number
    cURL JavaScript Node Python
    curl --request POST \
  --url .../auth/emails/signup \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --form 'firstName=Something' \
  --form 'middleName=Something' \
  --form 'lastName=Something' \
  --form 'description=Something' \
  --form 'email=Something' \
  --form 'photo=' \
  --form 'password=Something'
    fetch('.../auth/emails/signup', { 
    method: 'POST', 
    headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }, 
    body: 'firstName=Something&middleName=Something&lastName=Something&description=Something&email=Something&photo=&password=Something', 
}) 
.then(e => e.json()) 
.then((data) => { 
    console.log('Request succeeded with JSON response', data); 
}) 
.catch((error) => { 
    console.log('Request failed', error); 
});
    const request = require('request');
 
const options = { 
    method: 'POST', 
    url: '.../auth/emails/signup', 
    qs: {"firstName": "Something","middleName": "Something","lastName": "Something","description": "Something","email": "Something","photo": "","password": "Something"}, 
    headers: {"Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"}, 
};
 
request(options, function (error, response, body) { 
    if (error) throw new Error(error);
 
    console.log(body); 
});
    import requests

url = ".../auth/emails/signup"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
}

body = {
    "firstName": "Something",
    "middleName": "Something",
    "lastName": "Something",
    "description": "Something",
    "email": "Something",
    "photo": "",
    "password": "Something"
}

response = requests.POST(url, headers=headers)

    Signin with email and password to the application


    post ... /auth/emails/signin Try Out

    • Request
    • Response
    • Coding

    formData

    email REQUIRED

    string

    User's email address.

    password REQUIRED

    string

    User password.

    200

    Example Value | Model

    {
    "accessToken": "",
    "requestToken": "",
    "user": {
        "hash": "",
        "id": "",
        "email": "",
        "password": "",
        "description": "",
        "name": {
            "first": "",
            "middle": "",
            "last": ""
        },
        "photo": "",
        "isVerified": "",
        "authTypes": [
            {}
        ],
        "roles": {
            "isAdmin": "",
            "isSuperAdmin": ""
        },
        "lastSignedInAt": "",
        "signedUpAt": ""
    }
}
    • accessToken * string
    • requestToken * string
    • user * object Additional Properties: false
      • hash * string
      • id * string
      • email * string
      • password * string
      • description * string
      • name * object Additional Properties: false
        • first * string
        • middle * string
        • last * string
      • photo * undefined
      • isVerified * boolean
      • roles * object Additional Properties: false
        • isAdmin boolean
        • isSuperAdmin boolean
      • lastSignedInAt * number
      • signedUpAt * number
      cURL JavaScript Node Python
      curl --request POST \
  --url .../auth/emails/signin \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --form 'email=Something' \
  --form 'password=Something'
      fetch('.../auth/emails/signin', { 
    method: 'POST', 
    headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }, 
    body: 'email=Something&password=Something', 
}) 
.then(e => e.json()) 
.then((data) => { 
    console.log('Request succeeded with JSON response', data); 
}) 
.catch((error) => { 
    console.log('Request failed', error); 
});
      const request = require('request');
 
const options = { 
    method: 'POST', 
    url: '.../auth/emails/signin', 
    qs: {"email": "Something","password": "Something"}, 
    headers: {"Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"}, 
};
 
request(options, function (error, response, body) { 
    if (error) throw new Error(error);
 
    console.log(body); 
});
      import requests

url = ".../auth/emails/signin"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
}

body = {
    "email": "Something",
    "password": "Something"
}

response = requests.POST(url, headers=headers)

      Send verification email to the email attached in the request body. A token is attached to the query params of the redirectUrl and sent along. Extract the token and use it for the verify endpoint


      post ... /auth/emails/verify/mail Try Out

      • Request
      • Response
      • Coding

      formData

      email REQUIRED

      string

      User's email address.

      redirectUrl REQUIRED

      string

      The url that gets attached in the mail for the user to redirect to.

      200

      Example Value | Model

      {}
        cURL JavaScript Node Python
        curl --request POST \
  --url .../auth/emails/verify/mail \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --form 'email=Something' \
  --form 'redirectUrl=Something'
        fetch('.../auth/emails/verify/mail', { 
    method: 'POST', 
    headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }, 
    body: 'email=Something&redirectUrl=Something', 
}) 
.then(e => e.json()) 
.then((data) => { 
    console.log('Request succeeded with JSON response', data); 
}) 
.catch((error) => { 
    console.log('Request failed', error); 
});
        const request = require('request');
 
const options = { 
    method: 'POST', 
    url: '.../auth/emails/verify/mail', 
    qs: {"email": "Something","redirectUrl": "Something"}, 
    headers: {"Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"}, 
};
 
request(options, function (error, response, body) { 
    if (error) throw new Error(error);
 
    console.log(body); 
});
        import requests

url = ".../auth/emails/verify/mail"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
}

body = {
    "email": "Something",
    "redirectUrl": "Something"
}

response = requests.POST(url, headers=headers)

        Verify the email that corresponds to the token attached in the request body


        post ... /auth/emails/verify Try Out

        • Request
        • Response
        • Coding

        formData

        token REQUIRED

        string

        The token used to identify a user's email. It is usually send along in the query params of a redirect url.

        200

        Example Value | Model

        {
    "accessToken": "",
    "requestToken": "",
    "user": {
        "hash": "",
        "id": "",
        "email": "",
        "password": "",
        "description": "",
        "name": {
            "first": "",
            "middle": "",
            "last": ""
        },
        "photo": "",
        "isVerified": "",
        "authTypes": [
            {}
        ],
        "roles": {
            "isAdmin": "",
            "isSuperAdmin": ""
        },
        "lastSignedInAt": "",
        "signedUpAt": ""
    }
}
        • accessToken * string
        • requestToken * string
        • user * object Additional Properties: false
          • hash * string
          • id * string
          • email * string
          • password * string
          • description * string
          • name * object Additional Properties: false
            • first * string
            • middle * string
            • last * string
          • photo * undefined
          • isVerified * boolean
          • roles * object Additional Properties: false
            • isAdmin boolean
            • isSuperAdmin boolean
          • lastSignedInAt * number
          • signedUpAt * number
          cURL JavaScript Node Python
          curl --request POST \
  --url .../auth/emails/verify \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --form 'token=Something'
          fetch('.../auth/emails/verify', { 
    method: 'POST', 
    headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }, 
    body: 'token=Something',

    console.log('Request succeeded with JSON response', data);

          Auth/Identities

          Signup with google token. After successful google auth on client, an idToken and accessToken is generated for the user. Send them in the body of this request


          post ... /auth/identities/google Try Out

          • Request
          • Response
          • Coding

          formData

          idToken REQUIRED

          string

          Generated on the client after successful google auth.

          accessToken REQUIRED

          string

          Generated on the client after successful google auth.

          200

          Example Value | Model

          {
    "accessToken": "",
    "requestToken": "",
    "user": {
        "hash": "",
        "id": "",
        "email": "",
        "password": "",
        "description": "",
        "name": {
            "first": "",
            "middle": "",
            "last": ""
        },
        "photo": "",
        "isVerified": "",
        "authTypes": [
            {}
        ],
        "roles": {
            "isAdmin": "",
            "isSuperAdmin": ""
        },
        "lastSignedInAt": "",
        "signedUpAt": ""
    }
}
          • accessToken * string
          • requestToken * string
          • user * object Additional Properties: false
            • hash * string
            • id * string
            • email * string
            • password * string
            • description * string
            • name * object Additional Properties: false
              • first * string
              • middle * string
              • last * string
            • photo * undefined
            • isVerified * boolean
            • roles * object Additional Properties: false
              • isAdmin boolean
              • isSuperAdmin boolean
            • lastSignedInAt * number
            • signedUpAt * number
            cURL JavaScript Node Python
            curl --request POST \
  --url .../auth/identities/google \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --form 'idToken=Something' \
  --form 'accessToken=Something'
            fetch('.../auth/identities/google', { 
    method: 'POST', 
    headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }, 
    body: 'idToken=Something&accessToken=Something', 
}) 
.then(e => e.json()) 
.then((data) => { 
    console.log('Request succeeded with JSON response', data); 
}) 
.catch((error) => { 
    console.log('Request failed', error); 
});
            const request = require('request');
 
const options = { 
    method: 'POST', 
    url: '.../auth/identities/google', 
    qs: {"idToken": "Something","accessToken": "Something"}, 
    headers: {"Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"}, 
};
 
request(options, function (error, response, body) { 
    if (error) throw new Error(error);
 
    console.log(body); 
});
            import requests

url = ".../auth/identities/google"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
}

body = {
    "idToken": "Something",
    "accessToken": "Something"
}

response = requests.POST(url, headers=headers)

}

              Send reset email to the email attached in the request body. A token is attached to the query params of the redirectUrl and sent along. Extract the token and use it for the reset endpoint


              post ... /auth/passwords/reset/mail Try Out

              • Request
              • Response
              • Coding

              formData

              email REQUIRED

              string

              User's email address.

              redirectUrl REQUIRED

              string

              The url that gets attached in the mail for the user to redirect to.

              200

              {}

  --url .../auth/passwords/reset/mail \

  --form 'redirectUrl=Something'
                fetch('.../auth/passwords/reset/mail', {

    },

headers = {

response = requests.GET(url, headers=headers)

                    • Response

    method: 'PUT', 
    url: '.../auth/user', 
    qs: {"firstName": "Something","middleName": "Something","lastName": "Something","description": "Something","photo": ""}, 
    headers: {"Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"}, 
};
 
request(options, function (error, response, body) { 
    if (error) throw new Error(error);
 
    console.log(body); 
});
                      import requests

url = ".../auth/user"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
}

body = {
    "firstName": "Something",
    "middleName": "Something",
    "lastName": "Something",
    "description": "Something",
    "photo": ""
}

response = requests.PUT(url, headers=headers)

                      A trusted email is saved on the db in case a malicious admin decides to unset other admins roles. Calling this endpoint will set the superAdmin role on the account assoicaited with the role. Only that mail is allowed to have the superAdmin role


                      get ... /auth/user/superAdmin Try Out

                      • Request
                      • Response
                      • Coding
                      200

                      Example Value | Model

                      {}
                        cURL JavaScript Node Python
                        curl --request GET \
  --url .../auth/user/superAdmin
                        fetch('.../auth/user/superAdmin', { 
    method: 'GET', 
}) 
.then(e => e.json()) 
.then((data) => { 
    console.log('Request succeeded with JSON response', data); 
}) 
.catch((error) => { 
    console.log('Request failed', error); 
});
                        const request = require('request');
 
const options = { 
    method: 'GET', 
    url: '.../auth/user/superAdmin', 
};
 
request(options, function (error, response, body) { 
    if (error) throw new Error(error);
 
    console.log(body); 
});
                        import requests

}

response = requests.GET(url, headers=headers)
